FuncDef:
The radius-server nas-ip-address command configures a NAS-IP address for a device.
The undo radius-server nas-ip-address command restores the default setting.
By default, the IP address of the outbound interface for RADIUS packets is used as the NAS-IP address.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a NAS-IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The radius-server nas-ip-address command is used to configure a device's NAS-IP address as the destination IP address of a response packet to be sent from the RADIUS server.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
